column4: snappy: ok, i have mp3 files in /media/cdrom and some in ~/Desktop/rnb. i want to know if their is a possibility of uniq files in both locations
ok, i have mp3 files in /media/cdrom and some in ~/Desktop/rnb. i want to know if their is a possibility of uniq files in both locations
you can mount -obind one folder to a subfolder of the other, you can make hard- or softlinks the files to the other folder
or do oyu want to delete those files in your home folder which you have on cdrom?
something like that, but a preview will be good,maybe with grep or something
that worked, so how about deleting them?
well, i'd find /home/bla -exec if [ -e /media/cdrom/'{}`] ; then do rm /home/bla/'{}'; done \;     or something like this
also you could grep the diff output and xarg it to delete the dupes
if you want to find dupes, even if the name changed, use md5sum on the files and compare the output
mind pasting the two commands,my terminal does not support copy paste,id appreciate
they are not finished, or tested, and they include a "rm" command. read them, understand them, and modify them to fit your needs
they are not meant to be copy/pasted, as they are untested etc
how about sending them as files directly?
